Class AssetStorage

java.lang.Object
  AssetStorage

public final class AssetStorage
extends java.lang.Object

Storage containing all the assets in the game. Allows for easy addition and access of assets.

Author:
John Kim, Tanner Lai, Raymond Zhao

Constructor Summary
AssetStorage()
          This constructor sets up the AssetCreator and, by default, loads all the assets.
 
Method Summary
 java.util.ArrayList createAssets()
          This method creates a list of all the in game assets.

          This method returns the asset related to the specific entity id.
 Asset getAssetByLoc(int loc)
          This method returns the asset with the given position in the created list.
 int getHeight(int id, int frame)
          This method returns the width of the requested entity.
 int getWidth(int id, int frame)
          This method returns the width of the requested entity.

equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

AssetStorage

public AssetStorage()
This constructor sets up the AssetCreator and, by default, loads all the assets.

Method Detail

createAssets

public java.util.ArrayList createAssets()
This method creates a list of all the in game assets. To add more assets to this list, add it to the end of the assets ArrayList and add a comment indicating the position in the ArrayList for future reference.

getAsset

public Asset getAsset(int id)
This method returns the asset related to the specific entity id. ID Key: 1-99 : Backgrounds and Misc 100-199: Characters and enemies 200-299: Blocks 300-399: Items 999+: Questions

Parameters:
id - The id number of the entity.

getAssetByLoc

public Asset getAssetByLoc(int loc)
This method returns the asset with the given position in the created list.

Parameters:
loc - The position of the asset within the list of assets.

getWidth

public int getWidth(int id,
                    int frame)
This method returns the width of the requested entity. Returns -1 if not known yet.

Parameters:
id - The id number of the entity.
frame - The frame of the given entity.

getHeight

public int getHeight(int id,
                     int frame)
This method returns the width of the requested entity. Returns -1 if not known yet.

Parameters:
id - The id number of the entity.
frame - The frame of the given entity.
